text: (d) Consider a variation on decision stumps where each stump can consider k different features instead of just one. How would % affect the two parts of the fundamental trade-off? (e) Consider the following variation on the “condensed” k-nearest neighbour algorithm from your assignment: we make our predictions based on the m “best” training examples rather than all n training examples (for a fixed m). Would this be a parametric or a non- parametric model? (a) Supervised learning models take in an z; and output a y;, while many clustering methods also learn to predict a y; given an x;. What is the key difference in their training?
